Description: Rim and neck sherd of Chian pottery vessel with spur on inside, perhaps a trefoil oenochoe; white slip; interior glazed; exterior, glazze fired orange: band of short diagonal strokes at rim, above broken maeander band; glazed below.
Curator's comments: The vessel may have been used to support a small vessel with the spur. for other vessels with spurs, see British Museum 1924,1201.186 and 1924,1201.203. The shape of the vessel is difficult to determine but the rim pattern is consistent with the Animal Chalice, Grand and Chalice Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2201) (phase 2)
